column4: I wonder if anyone might be able to help with a problem I'm having installing ubuntu as a dual boot thing?
I ran the Live CD, and used the partitioner to create an Ubuntu partition, but it can't seem to boot up with it?
I think I may need to make sure the GRUB loader is working ok?
is there an easy way to see if the GRUB loader is working? (I've installed Ubuntu on a new partition, but only XP starts up..)
- well when I restarted having installed Ubuntu, it simply loads XP - but shows the smaller partition size..
how many disks you have? what disk did you install it on?
I've got three hard drives in.....
joe - thus far it simply offers to re-install Ubuntu....
joe is right i think boot back into ubuntu install grub on your mbr first disk
p'raps I need some partition advice then - 'cos I can simply re-do it then....
mount drive chroot into the install
